name: Kejapa bamboo and coffee house
address: Q2JV+4XR, Jl. Raya Tigawasa-Pedawa, Tigawasa, Kec. Banjar, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81152, Indonesia
review 1:
No doubt that this place gets a well deserved 5 star rating! What a lovely place and what a lovely people. We started with a coffee and tea with some small bites. Then we got a tour through the beautiful garden giving nice information about the different trees and plants. Then we learned how to make a basket from bamboo followed by a very nice lunch.

This is absolutely a good thing to do if you’re in or around Lovina. Don’t forget to buy the palm sugar and the coffee! You will love it!
review 2:
Go visit here. It is a must! The owner/guide is friendly informative and funny. It is a family run enterprise and gives a really local feel. It is so charming. The food is great. So much to see in a gorgeous setting. Steep steps and no handrails though.
Get coffee here!
review 3: Wonderful, authentic experience! A local family and community, including the kindest people you can think of, welcome you with excellent locally-grown coffee, tea and traditional snacks, show you through the beautiful field where they grow all sorts of exotic fruits and plants, explain the coffee-roasting process and the local traditions, teach you how to craft colourful Balinese baskets, and prepare THE MOST delicious local food, cooked by local villagers. Perfect for souvenirs too: you can buy Balinese baskets made on the spot and have them personalised, as well as little or bigger bags of their amazing coffee. Highly recommended!
review 4: The most charming visit you could imagine. Family run organic coffee plantation and kitchen garden. Set on a ridge in the clouds. See how coffee is grown, harvested, and roasted. Have a go at basket weaving and finish with a traditional lunch. You will not be disappointed. 5-stars.
review 5: We stopped here on the way to Lovina to get out of the rain, and glad we did! Beautiful coffee/tea and banana fritters. The male host is very hospital and friendly. The scenery is also quite serene and peaceful.

name: Kubu Alam Desa Tigawasa
address: Wanasari, Desa Tigawas, Buleleng Regency, Bali 81152, Indonesia
review 1: Please stop and enjoy the incredible view along the Bali coast. If you are there on a clear morning you can also see the mountains of Java. Good place to stop for Bali kopi and laklak. Owners are Kadek and Kadek. Wife has good English
review 2: You should definitely stop here and enjoy the sunset. It's a beautiful place
review 3: We made a nice stop at this particularly cheap warung with the hilltop sea view. Good alternative and worth to visit.
review 4: Nice place for selfie with lush of greenery  tropical plantations and view of the end of Northern part of Bali island

name: Rabat Beton Jalan Tukad Manuk
address: Q2HX+4W, Tigawasa, Banjar, Buleleng Regency, Bali, Indonesia
